results.title: The Tail
results.creator_credit: Yung Ting Lao and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
Amusing 2-D and 3-D computer animated tale about tails and their eventual destination as trophies on a wall. No dialogue.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.

results.title: Wilber
results.creator_credit: Laura Hunter and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
A spooky story of trickery and revenge, where good overcomes evil. Uses claymation and computer animation.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.

results.title: Terra firma
results.brief_description:
This cut-out animation started life as a 5-metre long conte drawing inspired by the various unseen energies that influence and create a dimension.
Original music by Steve Fraser, Dennis Phelan, Luke Von Banbergern. Animation by Julian lawrence.

results.title: Thrown away
results.brief_description:
A man contemplates suicide in a public lavatory cubicle. An unseen figure enters the space and proceeds to carry out the exact sequence ofevents that have bought the man to this critical moment. Is somebody playing a trick on him, or is this his doppelganger? Alarm turns to curiosity and he decides to investigate.
Written, directed and edited by Dan Thomas and featuring Christopher Hatherall as the man.

results.title: Silence speaks: digital storytelling project
results.creator_credit: ACMI and Center for Digital Storytelling US
results.brief_description: The content has been created as part of the “Silence Speaks” project, an international movement that provides the survivors of violence and abuse with an opportunity to tell their own stories. A co-production between ACMI and Center for Digital Storytelling (US) to coincide with Real Life on Film. “Silence Speaks” represents the most recent examples of Australian documentary making.

results.title: I think it's going to rain today
results.creator_credit: Joan Hobson, ACMI and Center for Digital Storytelling US
results.brief_description: The icy winter storm of abuse that a 14 year-old boy can bring upon a family. The unleashing of anger to deliberate acts of violence. Summer will come again but it will just take awhile.

results.title: Swarm
results.brief_description:
Sound and image projection specifically commissioned for Eyes Lies and Illusions in 2006.

Swarm, in the tradition of the phantasmagoria, hides the technology by which its effects are created. Multiple projections, motion sensors and speakers create the sense that the gallery is inhabited by insects, which emerge from a throbbing hive in a dark corner of the building to fly across the displays or swoop around visitors to the gallery. The work is unable to be seen in its entirety from any one place, it has no frame, no apparent beginning nor end. The bugs are free to move through the gallery space, just as we are. Swarm reacts to our presence, yet is beyond our control.

results.title: By the light of the moon
results.creator_credit: Broadmeadows Secondary College, Christine Rogers, Media, Applied Communications, RMIT and Alex Vagic
results.brief_description: “By the light of the moon” tells the story of two refugee girls, their reasons for leaving their home countries, their experiences, and how they came to be living in Broadmeadows and attending the Broadmeadows Secondary College. Essentially the film is about hope and optimism. Despite the difficulties faced by the two girls, and an acknowledgement that they can never forget the past, through sharing their stories they gain acceptance. They begin to connect with the community in which they now live, and have hope for the future.
